Nibb31.......You Are The MAN:cool: is there a specific part in the CFG file we need to add "scale = 1" and is "rescaleFactor = 1" also need and were do we put it? i dont want to mess it up not good at modding

Here:


// --- asset parameters ---
mesh = model.mu [COLOR="#0000FF"]// leave this as[/COLOR]
[COLOR="#0000FF"]// add the following parameters[/COLOR]
[COLOR="#008000"]scale = 1
rescaleFactor = 1[/COLOR]

Only add rescaleFactor if you want to convert the Dragon to 2.5m diameter. This will allow it to fit to either the Laztek or the KerbX Falcon.

Because of the size reduction, I also reduced the crew to 4, the engine thrust to 50, and the Monopropellant to 350, which is enough to rendez-vous a couple of times, deorbit and land. The original tank size was bit unrealistic. I also added a node inside the trunk for cargo, which could be an extra RCS tank if necessary.

Just a little note for everyone: if you're going to rescale the Dragon Rider to 2.5m, you should know a couple of things:

(1) The thrust animations and the physics positioning of the thrusters don't scale. The former is a cosmetic issue, but the latter actually affects how the capsule handles. I'd suggest also changing the engine power in the .cfg from 400 to 200 or so. Leaving it at 400 has, for me, made the capsule basically uncontrollable...

(2) If you have an existing Dragon Rider in flight, rescaling will wonkify it. Again, mostly cosmetic with one exception: the Dragon Brain will be floating above the docking port, and will keep the capsule from docking.

To fix the nose cone issue, edit the CFG file and replace "module = part" with "module = Part". It looks like 0.20 is case sensitive.

To fix the solar panel covers issue (and any other attachment node problems in 0.20), add the line "scale = 1" to all of the CFG files. All the files....that's it. Works great after that
